Reviews.Title: “Great location good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good size bedroom, good bed (slept really well. no road noise. Great location easy access to main sites. Would recommend it to a friend or family.

Reviews.Title: “In middle of the City”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Location on the Place Madelein was perfect for visting everything. The Metrostation was just a few steeps away. The Hotel is small but very clean, stylish and friendly. The rates of the rooms are good. We come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “My trip to pARIS”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fine stay. Good sleep. Silence and calm. Excellent breakfast. Kind personnel. Room comfortable. Very strategic for tourism. Easy to reach. Underground pretty close. Some inadequacy about cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “PSI. Pounds per square inch.”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: Before I booked this hotel I was rather apprehensive after reading the reviews. Still, I booked and took my chance and my apprehension was confirmed upon arrival. The hotel entrance was extremely small, not to mention the reception desk and area. However, after receiving my room keys and heading for the elevator I was pleasantly surprised to find the back room resembling that of an old English country club. Roaring open fire, albeit fake, wing backed high chairs and a literary assortment of Historical English books fit for any library. Next the room, as usual with Paris standards, rather cramped, but very nice all the same. The one down point, if any, was the fact that the bathroom was again very small and very very cold. The bathroom floor being covered in slate like tiles was as cold as the winter weather outside. All in all a very pleasant experience, would I recommend this hotel? Yes, but go for a Superior room to avoid a tight squeeze, room 104 was perfect with twin beds. Good luck

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: intrepidexpl0rers
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Opal could not be better situated, in one of the most central and exclusive areas of Paris. The hotel itself is beautifully appointed with great rooms and excellent bathrooms. After check-in we noticed that there was a problem with the shower door, but this was quickly attended to, and we were immediately moved to another room without fuss. Booked through Splendia and got great rates. I would definitely recommend and will no doubt return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sapphire73
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here recently, we were very pleased with both the hotel and the location. There is a small bar in the hotel, we had drinks in there one evening. I'd booked a superior room, and it was a good size. Nice modern decor, and it was kept spotlessly clean. Staff all very helpful and everyone I dealt with spoke good English. Would definitely stay there again, and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommendable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We can recommend the Opal-Hotel.The Hotel is located centrally in Paris with two Metrostations close by so it is easy to use public transportation. Louvre , Opera and Gallerie Lafayette are in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Well located upmarket small hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpivsUKOK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September for one night on business. Primary benefit of this hotel is its location, as others have said. It's a small hotel with an easy-to-miss entrance, so keep your eyes open. All public spaces very clean, smart and well furnished. My room was relatively small but the space was used very well so it actually felt much roomier than it really was. Nice bathroom. I was on about the third floor I think, windows opened out onto the street which gave a nioce view and wasn't as noisy as I expected. Just a couple of downsides. First, couldn't get the WiFi connection to work at all. Second, there is no bar or restaurant in the hotel. Although there are lots of places that you can go nearby, I prefer to have a bar and restaurant in the hotel where I stay, which is just a personal preference and why I give it three stars instead of four. All in all though this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: TobyJh
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for price and position. Surrounded by great shopping and more conveniently metro madelaine. Great walking distance to everywhere! Rooms are of a good size, beds are great, and bathrooms are clean. We enjoyed our stay immensely. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in front of Madeleine and his subway station, near Place Vendome, Opera and Place de la Concorde. The hotel is clean and the service is quite good, even if it's not unforgettable. Rooms are small and a little bit dark: actually, it's a good choice especially for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: jyvais
Reviews.Content: The reception area is not the most inviting, in a narrow hallway almost on the street but the initial mixed feeling stops there. The superior rooms are spotless and pretty large. Renovation was obviously pretty recent with a nice choice of colours and materials. Nice bathroom too. The x01 rooms are on the adjacent street and very quite. Certainly not the most romantic part of Paris but the one that let you shop till you die and walk to many of the key attractions. Official prices are sky high so look for internet deals.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, solid price”
Reviews.Author: Kirbea
Reviews.Content: Booked on hotels.com the night before and received a decent rate. Hotel was easy to find as Rue Tronchet is a fairly busy street and is close to a metro station. The rooms have a modern feel to them and were very clean. The lobby was chic and well-designed. There are numerous excellent, non-touristy restaurants to the north, our favorite was Chez Papa which had food from the southwest of France. We did not have the breakfast so I cannot comment on that aspect. The only downside is that the metro runs below the building and every few minutes or so you can hear a light rumble, very similar to thunder.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is stylish, warm and welcoming. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful and accomodating. We very much enjoyed our stay. Thank you! 

Reviews.Title: “Un piacevole soggiorno a Parigi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel situato in posizione eccellente a due passi dalle principali mete turistico culturali e dello shopping di parigi. Stanze confortevoli e decisamente ben pulite e moderne soprattutto se si considera che a Parigi le camere che sorgono in edifici datati non brillano per pulizia e dimensioni-Cortesia e gentilezza alla reception e buon rapporto qualità prezzo. Sono ormai diversi anni che veniamo 2/3 volte l'anno a Parigi e da almeno 5 in questo albergo. E' il miglior segnale della nostra soddisfazione. Un unico suggerimento: far illuminare i numeri dei tasti dell'ascensore

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A negative was at breakfast - tables not always set - could have more varied food selection. fruit had gone bad and not replaced with fresh fruit. room - good size, location very good. liked the location best and breakfast the least

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms; Rather Too Close To The Metro...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a pleasant stay at the BW Opera Opal with both the common areas & rooms being of a good cleanliness standard. The beds & sheets were very good & offered a high degree of comfort. The hotel is in a good location, being close to two different Metro lines…although this leads to other issues… The only downside was that out room was rather noisy. This was due to two factors - being on the 1st floor at the front next to the main road and also the fact that the Metro lines are relatively shallow in Paris and therefore every time a Metro train went under the building the whole room reverberated with the sound. I would assume this is less noticeable the further up your room is All things considered we would stay here again, but try to ensure we were high-up out the back

Reviews.Title: “Charming design location”
Reviews.Author: go-box-man Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very charming design hotel with helpful staff. I took a very cheap internet rate, so my room was quite small and and faced the lightyard. Breakfast was ok, when I asked for an iron, i immediately got one. I didn´t hear any other guests, but sometimes you can feel the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but too pricey for what it is”
Reviews.Author: caramel_bru
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a nice little hotel in a good location. While I'd say it is only just worth 4*, it is nice, clean, well-designed, offers free wifi and has an okay breakfast buffet. The rooms are quite small, yet do feel clean and quite new-ish. We booked at around half price with free breakfast since we stayed there in the middle of summer when Paris is on holidays so we were pleased, but I would expect more if I had to pay the standard price for a room and pay extra for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy boutique hotel with very cute room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my one-night stay on this hotel's top floor very much. Friendly staff, a neat and cozy - albeit small - room and excellent location. Everything was small-scale but done with very good taste.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great location and service.

Reviews.Title: “A neat and nice hotel at superb location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel for most of my business trips in Paris. It is a neat and nice hotel at very central location, offering good value for money if you do not insist on staying at the most prestigious hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Renovated three years ago, the hotel was in a very good shape and the room was clean. It was very quiet, although it was along the busy street. The receptionist was nice and helpful in offering choices for the entertainment. One compaint is that the elevator was rather slow. The rate was a bit high, probably because the reservation was made last minute.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't swing a cat”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderfully situated, but the room was a disgrace for a 4 *. It was tiny. We had to enter sideways, as you could hardly open the door (the bed was in the way). You couldn't watch the TV from the bed, without getting a neck injury, because it was on a desk situated parallel to the left hand side of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Odd_Traveller Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful, accomodating, comfortable and well appointed room, nice breakfast, characterful. Good location for accessing sights, shops and public transport. Genuinely enjoyed my very brief business stay and will have this hotel top of my list for future business or leisure visits

Reviews.Title: “In the centre”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Situation of the hotel is excellent for sightseeing but rather noisy outside. Superior double room on the sixth floor is big enough for 2 adults. Kingsize bed was ok. Air-condition worked excellently. Bathroom (whirlpool, no shower) without a door to close. Separate toilet - very clean. Staff very nice and competent. Breakfast was close to ok. (19 €) Lift very dark and small.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As during the previous stays in this hotel, we really enjoyed our weekend in this establishment due to its perfect location, friendly service, trendy equipment and cleanliness. We best liked the perfect service. The wardrobes might be a bit more spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cosy room..”
Reviews.Author: Es_s3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in early Nov10 and had hard time looking for this hotel (we stopped at the wrong train station!). Walking from the busiest street, ChampsElysees to Madeline took more than 30 minutes but upon reaching our hotel, we were relieved and satisfied with the cleaniness and decoration of the room. Hotel is near to Lafayette and shopping malls.. decent english breakfast and good service from the front desk.. Madeline train station is just 10metres away hence its really convenient to move around.. definitely recommended to all!

Reviews.Title: “Just a few details lacking”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I didn't like the shower. It was not "western friendly" and leaked everywhere. The bed was a double, so I assumed it would be for 2 people. In fact, it was two singles slid next to each other. There was a hook on the wall where artwork used to be. The room and the elevator were too dark. The breakfast room was too impersonal in design.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Opera Opal”
Reviews.Author: mervemerve Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is optimum and it is in a main road close to everything and in a nice neighborhood. The design of the hotel is very cosy and it is a beautiful boutique hotel. The common areas and the lobby are a little bit small but rooms are comfortable although they are not that big either. It is a new and clean hotel to stay. The staff are friendly and they even let us leave our luggages in the hotel for an entire night and a day when we went to Disneyland. I definitely would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful decor! Extraordinary staff! Excellent location! Perfect stay! Rooms very comfortable and very clean. I had a fantastic time! I truly recommend this hotel. Perfect for a romantic gateway.

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile enjoying an overnight in OPAL”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located blocks away from La Madelaine and Palaise Garnier, This boutique hotel provides an excellent alternative for large-crowded-mass-production accommodations in Paris, where the touch of personality and coziness is provided by its staff, led by Nathalie Du Pont, her Manager. The delicate and modern decoration makes you feel very comfortable as it is not one of those impersonal hotel coming out of a interior designers production line. Everything is clean and shiny, and though small, it's very comfortable. The breakfast is very good in quality and quantity, and you can always find that touch of French delicate details. Details that are no more details when they become a center issue: having your needs and wants satisfied. I could only find one downside- the lack of restaurant. Although OPAL provides you with a fresh-tasty-well-presented cold meal; a few hot dishes would be very convenient specially during winter time. Having said this, don't despair as Italian, Japanese, Spanish, French and Vietnamese restaurants are literally around the corner. And if you fancy the yellow-M-not-Paris-food, well, just walk a few more blocks and you'll find it close to Starbucks, Quick and Paul. By the way, don't miss a coffee in Cafe de La Pais, though you might need deeper pockets in case your appetite all of a sudden has been unleashed. As a bottom line, OPAL HOTEL is "the" hotel for Paris! Kind regards, Hernan Goldemberg (Argentina)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: fmxdan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first weekend in August 2011 and loved every minute of it. It's a great location, very central to most things and within 10-15 minute walking of the Opera, Concorde, train stations, etc. Plenty of cafes around, metro station(s), shopping, etc. Hotel is very clean, seems rather new or at least well kept up, great people at the front desk (all guys and girl speak great English in case you're lacking French like us) with pretty recommendations. We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, modern Hotel, very clean, helpful and friendly reception employees. Slept very well. It was very quiet. I will definitely recommend the place and book it for my next trip to Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “A great Value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: figsis
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint hotel near the Paris Opera House and close to some the best shopping in Paris. Rooms were comfortable but not luxurious....typical of a moderate price hotel in Europe. the staff was knowledgeable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a true four star hotel. The hotel room was clean, the bed comfortable and the bathroom was brand new and sparkling clean. I really enjoyed staying here. I had booked one night in this hotel online to see how it is first, and I loved it. In the morning, I tried to extend my stay but the rate had gone up more than three times. I went downstairs and asked the hotel receptionist to see if I could extend my stay one more night, and she said yes, but at a rate that was outrageous. Her excuse was that the hotel was almost full so they were going to ask for more money. At the rate they were asking, this hotel was not worth it, so I left. If I can get a good rate online, I would stay at this hotel any time.

Reviews.Title: “disappointment in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: How this property is rated 4 stars is a total mystery. I asked for the TV to be repaired 3 times without success. Had booked a 7 nite stay...and left after 4. There are many other hotels in this vicinity with far, far better values for the hefty costs they demand.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, helpful staffs, comfortable bed, the room is a bit small but very good compare with Paris norm. The hotel is close to a lot of tourist attractions and to metro station is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Basics should be at least in order in a hotel this level”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My room was not tidy - trash on the floor. Papers and bathroom assesories from the previus guest were left in the room. There was not remote control for the TV in the room, I called resecption, someone came and checked that the TV does not work without a remote control, he promised to find one for me and come back. Well, he never came back and I was without TV. More importantly I was left with a promise that the issue would be taken care of. The uncleaniness of the room and unkept promises which I regards as very poor service left me with very bad feeling of this hotel. I travel a lot and have recently used on several occasions one of your other hotels in Paris so was excpectin a good experience what I was used to.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: vivre4u Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Cozy hotel in center of Paris. Service is good compared to price paied. If you go by car the only problem is baggage loading and unloading. No parking in fron of the hotel. Small but new and well fitted rooms. Wifi internet free. Parking not far about 35 euro per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great Location and very comfortable hotel. The elevator is a little dark and small but the stairs work well. Very clean and very good service from the front desk. A little noisy in the rooms on the front of the hotel but close the windows tight and turn on the a/c and it becomes much quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good access to Opera, St Lazzare St. and some shopping area. Kind,communiactive and helpful staff! Rooms depends on the chance, some are tiny without bathtab, but still comfortable...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a hotelsgrandparis.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In our opinion this is an excellent hotel. Small and compact but really well fitted out. Our room was not too small although I understand that others are. Bed very comfortable, very good bathroom and shower. Good breakfast and helpful hotel staff. Found it to be very well located near to La Madeleine church and a brasserie on the corner of Place de La Madeleine which was very good. Restaurants in the street next to the hotel are overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Safe location, comfortable lodging, a bit expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Allymarieus
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff made this hotel a pleasant experience. After arriving in Paris to discover the budget hotel I had picked had bedbugs, I was without a place to stay at 6pm. As a solo female traveler this was not ideal. Thus found this hotel. On the expensive side, especially considering that there were some cheaper options in the area (which I found out too late after booking). But they provided me with a comfortable and clean experience. Plus the staff was great--with only thirty-three rooms, they were able to know me personally. Unless you can get the breakfast thrown in for free, not really worth the price--nearby bakeries or cafes can give you cheaper options. Try to ask for a deal, call ahead, scan websites. It was pricey, but a fine experience.

Reviews.Title: “Only a 2 star hotel given the price”
Reviews.Author: Flemming_Meineche
Reviews.Content: Nicely located in the shopping district and near tourist highlights of Paris, this would seem as the perfect place for a stay in Paris. But it is not - the rooms are very small, albeit clean, and do not leave much space for anything but a bed and a bag. The television in my room was on the wall to the side of the bed. Breakfast was primarily premade stuff. Most annoying was the fact that the complimentary wifi rarely worked (I had to buy access on the hotel's computer even though I told the staff that the free wifi was not working). And finally, the metro is located under the hotel making noise all the time. I know that pricing is high in Paris and that I ordered late, but even considering that I think the hotel was expensive. So all in all, I cannot recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anon100001
Reviews.Content: This is an average 3* hotel. Initially, I swap rooms three times as they had not correctly sorted out our booking, eventually we were given a tiny room (which they said was superior). Rooms are also paper thin - which means you can hear other guests. This hotel is adequate and very well located but there are others around the same area which are better quality and cheaper. Another downside was no tea/coffee or iron in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a fantastic location, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: noelle75
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to two metro stops: Madeleine and Havre-Caumartin, but you can walk everywhere. It is in an area full of upscale cafes such as Laduree, Hediard and Fauchon and the grands magasins of Rue Haussmann. The rooms are large with queen size beds and nice bathrooms with plenty of towels and amenities. I had the continental breakfast served in the room and it was very nice: tea, orange juice, patisseries, bread, yogurt and cheese. It was expensive at 19EUR but the hotel is in a very expensive part of Paris. My room looked out on rue Tronchet but I never heard a thing through the double-glazed windows. Free wireless is great--every hotel should offer this! The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is spotless. I booked a very good rate off of booking.com; normal rates are close to 400EUR. I think that's too pricy for this hotel--but if you can get a good deal, you will enjoy your time here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: lismell
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel in January. While the location is great with metro and Champs Elysee near by the service was very poor. First when we got to the room there werent any towels there so we called down to ask for it. The lady working the reception questioned that fact that there was no towels there but said she would come up. When she came up she only brought towels for one person. We didnt realise this until she was gone so called down again and said we need one towel each. The lady said we could come down and get the towel ourself. We said we would do it later on but eventually she did come up with it. I was shocked by her response. When the hotel gets a taxi for your it costs a bit more, so we decided to just the one in the streets. When politely declining her offer to get us a taxi, she replied "suit yourselfs...." and looked the other way. Internet cost 8 euro per HALF HOUR! That is just so ridiculous!! Small breakfast was expensive and you could hardly eat anything. When the lady working in the reception explained the breakfast rules, we didnt quite understand everything, so we wanted to double check and asked if what we understood was right. She rolled her eyes and said "I JUST told you....". I have never experienced worse service at a hotel. The other staff there was very nice and polite but she really did ruin the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: 2quteDurban
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been recently refurbished, rooms were small but well decorated and bathroom was clean and modern. Great location, close to champ elysee and metro madeleine just a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kittymiow
Reviews.Content: I love this little cute hotel. The room is comfy clean and well decorated. The staff in the hotel are friendly and speak good English. The location is unbeatable, restaurants,shopping centers just a few minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Richiewoodhouse
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal for this lovely hotel right in the centre of Paris. Location is fantastic. Rooms have been renovated. Our room was massive. we upgraded to a superior when we got there but it only cost about 10 euros extra. Staff were very very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great stay”
Reviews.Author: conidis
Reviews.Content: It is a hotel that you really long to go back to and get some rest after a long and exhausting tour de Paris. Excellent decoration and very helpful and kind staff. A very beautiful cafe right next to it. Near metro station (which place isn't in Paris?...) We would certainly book there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel, just a shame about the noise from the metro”
Reviews.Author: YolandeSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: Just back from a fantastic trip to Paris. We really liked the clean and modern rooms, however it was very small. We are used to travelling around europe and smaller rooms etc, but i dont know if this was just our luck at this hotel but the room was the smallest we have come across. The location is fantastic 5 min walk to the Champs Elysees, and we used the metro stop outside the hotel. The staff where all extremely helpful and polite. The only really bad point that I have for this hotel is The Metro. We where on the 2nd floor and the noise from the metro was terrible. I can usually sleep with outside noise quite easily but I really struggled with the noise from the metro :-( If you dont mind the metro rumbling below you every couple of minutes then this is a great hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Really Stylish Room”
Reviews.Author: Cheezypuf
Reviews.Content: I stayed there just before New Years day and enjoyed by stay. The room was on the third floor and was immaculately decorated. The bathroom was also very well appointed. Not that it spoilt my stay, but there were a few small niggles – a small bottle of water form the minibar in the room cost €5 or €6 from the bar downstairs. To my mind having a glass of water beside your bed shouldn’t cost so much, especially when the same bottle can be bought for 60 cents just outside the hotel. The hotel is also over a metro line, so there’s a bit of a rumble every few minutes as a train passes, but it’s not too severe. The hotel doesn’t have a proper restaurant, but I’d really recommend a nearby restaurant called Le Roi du Pot au Feu http://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g187147-d719414-Reviews-Le_Roi_du_Pot_au_Feu-Paris_Ile_de_France.html

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: sardouk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for five days in July and we really had a wonderful experience . The hotel is nicely located right next to the printemps galleries , with a metro station right across the street. The rooms are tiny , the elevator is tiny , the bathroom is tiny but everything is impeccably clean , modern and pretty . The staff was very helpful , and helped us make reservations, find a converter for our Canadian cell phone charger and they were always ready to help. If you like huge hotel lobbies and bell boys this hotel is not for you , but if you are looking for a nice modern clean room in the heart of Paris , stay at the Opal and you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated, new room. I'm impressed!”
Reviews.Author: MsEllen88
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of the hotel Opal (latest was in 2007), I visited the hotel website and saw that the hotel was completely renovated. We booked out stay and got a great rate on a popular booking website. We were delighted that every room and every corner of the hotel was totally renovated in a modern, clean style. The lobby is tiny, but nicely decorated in ultra contemporary furnishings. Our room was a decent size, for Paris anyway, and it had a surprisingly modern Chinese theme with real silk curtains and nice linens. The bathroom was totally new with a towel warmer and a great shower....hard to understand at first, but once we learned how to make it work, it was a dream. Our room had a flat screen TV, mini bar, and Lanvin brand bath amenities. The location is perfect...about a block from La Madeleine in the heart of Paris, a two minute walk to the metro, and a five minute walk to large department stores. Best of all, there are wonderful restaurants within a three block walk, plus two great gourmet stores (Fauchon, Hediard) and Nicolas, the wine shop. The only drawbacks: 1. the breakfast was 23 Euros ( over $30) per person, and not a good value, so try the corner cafe or bakery. 2. the Metro line runs directly under the hotel and we could hear the noise and feel the vibration from our 5th floor room. If you are are light sleeper, ask for a room that does not face the street. The room might be smallish, but definitely quieter. The plus side: all of the hotel staff we met were wonderful, and super helpful. There is also an internet PC in the lobby for guest use (and free). There are other Best Westerns in Paris, in fact dozens of them, but the Opal is part of the "Premier" level of B-W hotels, and definitely a step above the standard tourist hotel, but a few steps short of luxury class hotels.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip To Europe”
Reviews.Author: busy_body_traveler
Reviews.Content: PARIS... Need I say anything more? The Hotel Opal was a nice little hotel that was in a great area. The furnishings were pretty old and the beds were not that great. However, I must say I got my monies worth. The subway station was a 3 minute walk to the right of the hotel and the transit system was really easy to use. We had a great time. The one thing I would recommend to all travelers is to make sure you map out what you want to do before you arrive because everything is so spreadout. Here is what we did and staying at the Hotel Opal made it possible: Day 1 - Arrived and shopped Boulevard Haussment (expensive) went to Les Bain Douche (Hip Hop Club) Day 2 - All day at Versaille (catched the subway) had dinner at the Buddha Bar (10 minute walk from Hotel) Day 3 - Invalides (Napolean's Tomb), Eiffel Tower, Arch De Triumphe, Champs Elysees (dinner La Madeleine - best restaurant EVER... outside the hotel in small alley on right) Day 4 - The Louvre (dinner at ManRay - John Depp's Restaurant) Day 5 - Flea Market - La puces marche Please keep in mind there is NOWHERE to eat breakfast on SUNDAY....

Reviews.Title: “OK But Some Problems”
Reviews.Author: Weekender365
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 3rd floor and never heard any sonic boom either. The most we heard was a rumble for a few seconds when a metro departed/arrived underground. We had no problem sleeping through the gentle rumble. Our room was OK except for some black mushroom growth spreading over the ceiling cracks above our bed. We joked that it added character and age to the place. Our room size was fine, not what I would consider generous by any means, but we're not running into walls either. I don't think the furniture is that old, they're just banged up by previous guests. The only thing I wished to be better was the tiny old TV is placed so low. I had to sit at the foot of the bed just to watch it. The old walnut painted refrigerator below the TV leaked some moisture/dampness into the carpet but it didn't have any mushroom odor or anything. We like this hotel for its location, close enough to the normal shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Whats the problem?”
Reviews.Author: Paul Heath
Reviews.Content: After some of the poor reviews ,l had to drag my wife there in the hope they would be wrong Well they were, no sonic booms under the hotel,only a low rumble not really heard in room 302. Room ,yes tired but very clean and dust free (well reading some of the reviews we had to check. Breakfast very good fare, Staff good english, understanding ,helpful very polite Lociation well what better travel ,airport Rossy bus from Opera only 5 minutes away,Metro even closer Well postioned for stores and the Concorde

Reviews.Title: “We encountered no problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although a bit apprehensive after reading all of the TripAdvisor reviews of the Hotel Opal, we're happy to say we encountered no problems whatsoever. The hotel was very clean and the staff was always helpful in answering any questions we had. The price was exactly as we were quoted via an internet booking. We were not charged for any extras as we'd heard others had experienced. Our booking stated the price of breakfast was included in our rate, and indeed it was. The two small breakfast rooms were clean and had a fairly large selection. (It's Europe, so we didn't expect IHOP.) Yes, our room and bath were small, but always clean. The furnishings were slightly worn, but European in style. (If we'd wanted the Holiday Inn, we'd have stayed at home.) Centrally located with easy access to the Metro (the noise of which didn't annoy us), the Opera, the Louvre/Tuileries and Place de la Concorde. We intend to rebook Hotel Opal the next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: rod8137
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opal for three nights. The location of the Hotel was superb, next to the Madeleine station. Our room was bigger than I anticipated for European standards. Our bed was comfortable and the bathroom roomy and clean. We found all the employees very nice and helpful. Our breakfast was tasty with a good assortment of breads and pastries. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Opal is just right if”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Opal is right place to stay if just for sleeping purposes. This is our third stay here, and have noticed decline in decor (first stay was in 1993, second stay 2003). However our room on 2nd floor was clean, bathroom huge, overlooking Mathurins. No complaint about noise. Staff helpful, friendly, allows storage of luggage before or after check out. Convenient location. The only problem we had was that they would not honor the new room price they quoted by phone to my sister who lives in Paris (with confirmation fax); they insisted that we pay the originally quoted price before the room change was made.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: AAA765
Reviews.Content: We were referred to Hotel Opal after the hotel we had originally reserved had overbooked. Don't be fooled by the photos on the website - this is an old and very tired hotel. There is little charm to it. Our room was recently painted and the room still maintained a strong smell of paint; we therefore, had to open the window to sleep, which was not convenient since the hotel is on a busy street. The carpets were dirty as were the bed covers. The bathroom was full of mold and dust. The breakfast is a joke - no real coffee (it's hot water and nescafe!), and the wait for a cup and utensils is about 20 minutes. We went back to our originally reserved hotel after the first night. Interestingly enough, there were 2 other couples complaining about the hotel to the manager and were also in the process of checking out after only one night.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere to sleep, but not eat.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was 'tired' and in need of extensive restoration. The first room we were offered was no more than a back room cupboard with a T.V, Loo and Shower etc. squeezed in it. It looked out on the downpipes and drains of the upper floors (this was at the rear of the building). It was not acceptable and so a change was requested - this was granted with no real problem. The noise from the Metro (it must run underneath the Hotel) kept you awake with its rumblings and shakings etc. The Hotel is in a good location for all the major sites of Paris and, for those fit enough, a lovely walk to the River Senn where 'hop on and hop off' river boats offer a lovely break with supberb views. The Hotel also is in easy reach of all the main coffee houses and restaurants. Sadly, although, the Hotel advertised bar and drinks, this was not available (unless you count the cupboard in the side room, that doubled as a breakfast room). Really it was somewhere to sleep, no other facilities were available.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel despite reading mixed reviews here and on expedia. I was apprehensive of the outcome but was pleasantly surprised. THE ARRIVAL: We arrived early morning of the day of the check-in (around 8 AM). The person at the front desk told us that we would have to wait around 40 minutes for our room. We wanted to put our luggage there and were told we could put it in our room itself as it just needed cleaning. We did so and returned in 30 minutes to find our room ready and cleaned. THE ROOM: We stayed in 202. It looked pretty much like in the pictures. The bed was of decent size and everything worked in the room. There were two small closets. The bathroom was decent sized with the shower tub. THE ENVIRONMENT: We did not find the Opal to be noisy at all. We could not hear anyone from inside the room. THE STAFF: The staff was friendly and answered all questions politely. THE BAD: 1. One leg of the bed gave way one night on its own. Upon reporting the next morning it was "fixed" in a temporary fashion and a result the bed was still tilting to one side. There was only one night left and hence we did not make a big fuss of this. 2. Upon checkout the price was different than the booking had stated. The guy at the front desk expressed surprise and made us think that perhaps it was due to "other" charges. I persisted that since we had no other charges on the room, the quoted price was wrong, he came up some theory that they had made mistake and quoted us price of two nights for our three night stay. Nevertheless, he made us pay only what was our original amount. I was relieved. Other recommendations: 1. Skip the "Weekend Cafe" below the hotel. 2. Buy water and othe groceries etc at any Supermarche instead of small stores around since the price difference is astounding. Skip the minibar in the room as well.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not Parisian chic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through expedia as it looked gorgeous on the website and we wanted to stay somewhere nice as it was a special ocassion. On getting there we were given a room in the 6th floor loft conversion. The lift did not go to this floor and it was a struggle getting our luggage up. The room was disgusting and tiny and the management just shrugged when we said how bad it was. On complaining they advised that as we had booked that room through Expedia, it was in the small print that you could be on the 6th floor. We are still waiting to hear from Expedia regarding the booking. We were moved on the third night to a better room which still wasn't the standard we had expected in the first place. Definately worth avoiding this hotel, anything but luxury. Also as it was booked through an operator we could not get our money back and move elsewhere. It was however slightly entertaining as the matress was that bad that you rolled into the middle of the bed and bumped into each other!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: LanceFan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July and thought it was great. The room we stayed in was small, but not tiny, but the bathroom was quite large and the tub was nice and deep. One thing I am not used to is not having a shower curtain - so this posed a slight problem for me as my "bull in a China shop" approach to bathing left the marble tiled floor quite drenched and extremely slippery. One of the people at the front desk, Pascal, was extremely helpful and friendly, but the others were a bit standoffish and cold. The breakfast was 12 Euros each, which was a bit pricey for no hot options, but the croissants were plentiful and very good. Very close to the Tube station (Madeline), and walking distance to the Concorde, Arc du Triumphe, Champs Elysees. Overall we were happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Opal-a quirky home base for your Paris adventure!”
Reviews.Author: cymbalineshalo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Opal with another couple the week of May 2nd through the 8th. We had rooms 105 and 102, respectively. My husband and I had consulted this site before our trip and decided to book the hotel anyway, in spite of the mixed reviews, because we felt the Hotel Opal had a good combination of affordability as well as an excellent location. Our room, 105, was decorated in a blue toile fabric and had a ivory marble bathroom. I agree with the previous posters that the furniture was somewhat worn and beat up but it didn't bother us...it just gave the place more character. The two light blue chairs that were in our room were newer looking, and the heavy toile drapes and the fabric on the walls looked fresh. This room faces the street, but with the double glazed windows closed you couldn't hear a thing. Our co-traveler's room, room 102, was hung in a pale pink Moire that looked somewhat shabby, as did their carpet, and their furniture looked a lot more battered than ours. Their bathroom was beautiful black and white marble, however. The hallways were neat and I enjoyed the very Parisian feel of the hand-painted lettering on each door and the solid tassel and skeleton key that they gave us to open our rooms. The main lobby and breakfast area is very small, but just as charming as the website photos. The staff we encountered had varying degrees of helpfulness from extremely helpful to mildly grumpy, all spoke english (but prefered it if you spoke French). The airconditioning unit in our room did not work and it was difficult to communicate that fact and have anything be done about it other than one of the front desk clerks coming up to our room and showing us how to use the remote-which wasn't the problem-it was that the unit itself did not cool. Luckily the weather was only warm for the first day otherwise we might have roasted. We ate breakfast at the Hotel one day-on a Sunday when absolutely nothing else was open. For your 12Euros you get a lot less than what you could manage at the so-so cafe next door-Just rolls and some ham and cereal and the like. The better thing to do for breakfast is to go down to the corner and buy incredible pasteries and coffee at Pauls'-and then come back for an incredibly filling 4Euro hotdog for lunch! A lot of people have complained about the Metro noise and honestly, being on the first floor, I thought it would make for a lot of sleepless nights. Based on others' reviews my husband and I had braced ourselves for the loud, shake-the-walls-and-jiggle-the-chandelier kind of Metro noise but got...a mild rumble. A really mild rumble and a slight vibration. Really noticeable only when one is say, in the bathtub with no other noise in the room. Its the kind of Metro sound and vibration that you feel and hear almost everywhere you go in Paris. I have to say that my husband and I found the Metro noise to be completely underwhelming, as did our traveling companions. All of us slept like angels. In terms of location, the Opal truly was as ideal as we had hoped, right in the middle of everything. The whole area is filled with very tony shops, like the Cartier and Gucci stores. La Duree is a short walk just past the Madeline for some of the worlds best macaroons and chocolat chaud. There's a Monoprix just off the Blvd Haussman, as well as two small groceries just half a block away for quick and cheap snacks and in room munching (skip the insanely priced mini bar fare). The Metro is just steps away and can get you almost anywhere you'd want to go in Paris quickly and cheaply. In short, I think that the Hotel Opal is what you make it. If you're willing to accept that there are going to be quirks and are willing to just roll with what you find, you'll have a great time. If you're expecting George V at Budgetel prices, or you're expecting that things will be exactly like you're used to at home, you're probably going to hate it-but then why are you traveling, anyway?

Reviews.Title: “A Detailed Impression”
Reviews.Author: Reiser
Reviews.Content: As most of us retain only 10% of our experience, we decided to write notes during our stay, here they are: THE ARRIVAL: We called from our previous hotel in the morning and was told that our room would definitely be ready at 2 PM so we should move then. When we arrived at Hotel Opal, the manager told us that the room was still being cleaned so we waited in the hotel till 3 PM. He finally suggested that we should just leave our suitcases and return at 4 PM as the cleaner was still backed up. The manager was nice but offered no apology at all. The lady receptionist who arrived in the late afternoon did apologize explaining that they had too many people checking out that day. We also like the german receptionist Monsieur Kerstner, he was quite friendly & helpful. THE ROOM: Room #405 looked nothing like the pictures at all, it's a very plain & spartan room with a double bed, so we requested for another room with 2 twin beds as we had requested in our reservation. Room # 305 looks just like the internet picture except the walls are muddy green. The room looks somewhat tired & worn out but the doors, windows & wall closet have a refreshing mint green paint on them. It has a certain charm with the brown carpet draped in busy pink flower design & the muddy green walls. The CEILING has multiple cracklines with some moisture MUSHROOM PROBLEM problem. In the evening, we could hear what the couple nextdoor were saying to each other as well as their TV quite clearly. THE FURNISHINGS: All the mini sized furniture have various different finish from walnut, mahogany to oak, some old & damaged, some new with a fake plasticky finish. We think they were all hand selected from a swap meet. The fake acrylic bronze painted chandelier & lamps (made in china?) and the 3 tiny & very old still oil painting with different colored frames convinced us further. The 13 inch TV sits on top of an old brown fridge while the modern portable air condition sits high on the wall. THE HALLWAY: Nicely black painted room doors gave a classy look but the dirty sheets/towels and garbage piled up against the wall by the lady cleaner during the day ruined it all. She seemed nice & friendly when I asked for towel sets & soap which she forgot to put in our room. The METRO SONIC BOOM: We found it to be tolerable as it never lasted more than 5 seconds each time, however, I would suggest requesting for the higher floors. We were more bothered by the sounds coming from next door. THE RETURN: Never again. Everytime we went back to our room we said to each other: It's like we died and went to hell....
